name: AITP
summary: Specifically addresses cross-trust-boundary interactions — the hardest problem. Capability modules (payments, decisions, identity) are well-scoped. But blockchain dependency and NEAR ecosystem ties create a subtle lock-in that contradicts the open protocol narrative.

feedbackLoop.note: Thread-based communication provides clear conversation history. On-chain verification.

edgeCases.note: Extensible capability modules mean edge cases grow with each AITP-0X spec.

ambiguity.note: Cross-trust negotiation is inherently ambiguous — agents from different orgs may interpret capabilities differently.

redundancy.note: Overlaps with A2A, x402, and AP2. Transaction capabilities duplicate x402's payment flow.

nesting.note: Threads containing capability messages containing structured data — 3 levels of nesting.

exitCost.note: Early stage. NEAR ecosystem dependency is the main cost.

identityPenetration.note: NEAR/Web3 identity is strong. AITP inherits the 'decentralized future' narrative.

agencyPreservation.note: Agents negotiate terms. Users can set constraints on what their agent can agree to.

controlInvisibility.note: Blockchain verification is visible, but the agent's negotiation logic is opaque to the user.

crisisMindset.note: 'The Internet of Agents needs a protocol NOW' — urgency framing.
